Metadata.Title: The Latest Security Patches Are Installed
Metadata.DirectLink: The Latest Security Patches Are Installed
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 6.1

What to Check For

The latest vendor-supplied security patches should be installed.

Why

Installing vendor-supplied security patches fixes known security vulnerabilities.

How to Check

Identify the patches installed on each system. Get the most current list of vendor-supplied patches. Make sure that all the applicable security patches supplied by the vendor are installed.

How to Fix

Install the patches in a test environment and test the patches in compliance with PCI DSS Requirement 6.3. Apply all the relevant missing patches to the production environment. Document the results of testing and the update process.
